alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carpenter, or 26 miles east of Cheyenne, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Large accumulations of hail up to half inch size. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Panorama Point and Carpenter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
